Key Arguments: The bill poses threats to freedom of speech.
There is a lack of clear definition and methodology for determining 'truth'.
Concerns about the independence of ACMA from the government in determining truth.
Exemptions in the bill allow certain parties to spread misinformation without penalty.
The bill could cause harm by enforcing misinformation as truth, leading to economic harm and societal stress.
The bill could be used to push agendas and suppress free speech.
Notable Quotes: This bill poses many implications to freedom of speech and allows some parties to deliberately spread misinformation.
The bill can cause more harm to society than what it is trying to solve.
The writer thinks the bill is more about pushing agendas and squashing free speech than promoting truth.
